page.title: 07 Sallow Coppice.
page.content:
Squelching mud clings to our boots, Leaving muddy trails where we passed. Distant noises can be heard, Like cars and vans,lorries and bikes.
Sallow Coppice,a remote wood, With lots of wildlife inside. Scurrying rabbits,mice and insects, Sweet singing birds with their chicks.
Sallow Coppice,such a tranquil place, Until the invaders appear,stamping down grass. Ants disappear in a rush, Taking cover in lush undergrowth.
Sallow Coppice full of trees, Oak,ash and even elm. Flowers line the mud laden paths, Busy bees fly hectically past.
